sentences.sContent: Extreme poverty still exists in many rural areas.
sentences.sCn: 许多农村地区仍处于赤贫状态。

sentences.sContent: He had extreme difficulty getting hold of the ingredients.
sentences.sCn: 他费了极大的劲找配料。

sentences.sContent: ...It is estimated that extreme weather conditions have endangered the lives of millions of African 	children...
...he says extreme events become disasters only when people fail to prepare for them...
...but we should not allow these extreme cases to distort our view of most young people...
...How can we stop extreme events from turning into disasters...
...describing it as a way to test robots developed by Korean researchers for use in extreme conditions...
...But the study warns that it is teenagers who engage in all three of these practices in the extreme who are truly in jeopardy...
...Duncan Watts proposes that the "Mona Lisa" is merely an extreme example of a general rule...
...Government regulation in America went from one extreme to the other in the past two decades...
...China is playing an increasingly important role in helping the international community to eliminate extreme poverty by 2030...
...some Swedish activists and legislators are demanding more extreme and far-reaching measures...
...writing breathlessly in the New York Times about the "rising incidence of extreme events"...
...In what way do the media benefit from extreme weather...

synos.tran: 极端的；极度的；偏激的；尽头的
极端；末端；最大程度；极端的事物

phrases.pCn: 极压，极限压力；特高压力；超高压

remMethod.val: extre(看作extra， 以外的) ＋ me(我) → 在我忍受的极限以外 → 极端， 过分

words.tran: 极端；绝境；非常手段；手足
极端主义（尤指政治上的极右或极左）；极端性；过激主义
